thread.title: 61 Wingsuit Divers Set Formation Record
thread.title_full: 61 Wingsuit Divers Set Formation Record : Discovery News

author: discovery news
title: 61 Wingsuit Divers Set Formation Record
text:
The skydiving record for the most wingsuit divers in formation while in freefall was set October 17 at California's Perris Valley Airport, The Press-Enterprise reports.
Photos: Wingsuit Flying Gets Competitive
The record-setters comprised a 61-strong, international team of wingsuiters who were dropped from three airplanes flying at 13,500 feet. Soon after, they formed a diamond shape and snared the record.
During the maneuver, the team glided horizontally for some 2 miles, the publication reports.
Once the formation was established, the divers soon flew apart from each other, creating the necessary space among them to safely complete their dives.
The record was certified by Federation Aeronautique Internationale, an air sports group. More people have flown in formation in earlier dives, The Press-Enterprise notes, but standards for such records are more tightly enforced today.
via The Press-Enterprise
Tags Current Events Adventure Activities Extreme Sports adventure Adventure Sports Skydiving
